1. LESEN: Lies src/pages/Dashboard.tsx um die aktuelle Struktur zu verstehen

3. TESTEN: F√ºhre 'npm run build' aus um sicherzustellen dass es kompiliert
4. DEPLOYEN: Rufe deploy_to_github auf um die √Ñnderungen zu pushen

import { StrictMode } from 'react'
import { createRoot } from 'react-dom/client'
import './index.css'
import App from './App.tsx'

createRoot(document.getElementById('root')!).render(
  <StrictMode>
    <App />
  </StrictMode>,
)

content.content:
1‚Üí---
     2‚Üíname: ui-first
     3‚Üídescription: |
     4‚Üí  Activate this skill when:
     5‚Üí  - Building a dashboard WITHOUT existing LivingApps apps
     6‚Üí  - No app_metadata.json exists
     7‚Üí  - User wants to design UI first, add data persistence later
     8‚Üí  - Creating plan.md for future app provisioning
     9‚Üíallowed-tools:
    10‚Üí  - Read
    11‚Üí  - Write
    12‚Üí  - Edit
    13‚Üí  - Bash
    14‚Üí  - Glob
    15‚Üí  - Grep
    16‚Üí---
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí# UI-First Dashboard Skill
    19‚Üí
    20‚ÜíYou are building a dashboard **without existing LivingApps apps**. The user wants to see a working UI first, and may later add data persistence.
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí## Your Mission
    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí1. **Build a fully functional UI** with mock data
    25‚Üí2. **Write plan.md** describing what LivingApps apps would be needed for persistence
    26‚Üí3. **Design the UI so it can easily connect** to real data later
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí---
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí## Workflow
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí### Step 1: Understand What the User Wants
    33‚Üí
    34‚ÜíRead the user's prompt carefully. Think about:
    35‚Üí- What data will this dashboard display?
    36‚Üí- What actions can users take?
    37‚Üí- What would need to be stored?
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí### Step 2: Design the Data Model (plan.md)
    40‚Üí
    41‚ÜíBefore building UI, create `plan.md` with:
    42‚Üí1. Human-readable description of proposed apps
    43‚Üí2. Machine-readable JSON schema for later provisioning
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí**IMPORTANT:** The JSON schema must be valid and complete. It will be used to automatically create LivingApps apps later.
    46‚Üí
    47‚Üí### Step 3: Build UI with Mock Data
    48‚Üí
    49‚ÜíCreate `Dashboard.tsx` using:
    50‚Üí- Hardcoded mock data that matches plan.md schema
    51‚Üí- Components that could easily connect to real API later
    52‚Üí- Full functionality (all features work, just with fake data)
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí### Step 4: Deploy
    55‚Üí
    56‚ÜíRun `npm run build` and deploy with `mcp__deploy_tools__deploy_to_github`
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí---
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí## plan.md Format
    61‚Üí
    62‚ÜíCreate `plan.md` in the project root with this exact structure:
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí```markdown
    65‚Üí# Persistence Plan: {Dashboard Name}
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí## Summary
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí{1-2 sentences describing the dashboard and its data needs}
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí## Proposed Apps
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí{For each app, write a human-readable description}
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí### App: {identifier}
    76‚Üí- **Name:** {Display name}
    77‚Üí- **Purpose:** {What this app stores}
    78‚Üí- **UI Components:** {Which dashboard components use this data}
    79‚Üí- **Fields:**
    80‚Üí  - `{field_name}` ({type}): {description}
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí## Relationships
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí{Describe how apps relate to each other}
    85‚Üí- {app1}.{field} -> {app2} ({relationship type})
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí## JSON Schema
    88‚Üí
    89‚ÜíThe following JSON is used for automatic app provisioning. **DO NOT EDIT MANUALLY.**
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí```json
    92‚Üí{
    93‚Üí  "apps": [
    94‚Üí    {
    95‚Üí      "name": "Display Name",
    96‚Üí      "identifier": "snake_case_identifier",
    97‚Üí      "controls": {
    98‚Üí        "field_name": {
    99‚Üí          "fulltype": "string/text",
   100‚Üí          "label": "Field Label",
   101‚Üí          "required": true,
   102‚Üí          "in_list": true
   103‚Üí        }
   104‚Üí      }
   105‚Üí    }
   106‚Üí  ]
   107‚Üí}
   108‚Üí```
   109‚Üí```
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí---
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí## Control Types Reference
   114‚Üí
   115‚ÜíUse these exact `fulltype` values in the JSON schema:
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí### Basic Types
   118‚Üí| fulltype | Use for | Example |
   119‚Üí|----------|---------|---------|
   120‚Üí| `string/text` | Single-line text | Name, Title |
   121‚Üí| `string/textarea` | Multi-line text | Description, Notes |
   122‚Üí| `string/email` | Email addresses | email@example.com |
   123‚Üí| `string/url` | URLs | https://example.com |
   124‚Üí| `string/tel` | Phone numbers | +49 123 456789 |
   125‚Üí| `number` | Numbers | Count, Amount |
   126‚Üí| `bool` | Yes/No | Is Active, Completed |
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí### Date Types
   129‚Üí| fulltype | Format | Example |
   130‚Üí|----------|--------|---------|
   131‚Üí| `date/date` | YYYY-MM-DD | 2025-01-30 |
   132‚Üí| `date/datetimeminute` | YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM | 2025-01-30T14:30 |
   133‚Üí
   134‚Üí### Lookup Types (Predefined Options)
   135‚Üí```json
   136‚Üí{
   137‚Üí  "fulltype": "lookup/select",
   138‚Üí  "label": "Status",
   139‚Üí  "lookups": [
   140‚Üí    {"key": "active", "value": "Active"},
   141‚Üí    {"key": "done", "value": "Done"},
   142‚Üí    {"key": "cancelled", "value": "Cancelled"}
   143‚Üí  ]
   144‚Üí}
   145‚Üí```
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üí### App Lookup (Reference to Another App)
   148‚Üí```json
   149‚Üí{
   150‚Üí  "fulltype": "applookup/select",
   151‚Üí  "label": "Category",
   152‚Üí  "lookup_app_ref": "categories"
   153‚Üí}
   154‚Üí```
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí**Note:** `lookup_app_ref` uses the identifier of another app in the same plan. The actual URL will be filled in during provisioning.
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üí---
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí## Mock Data Pattern
   161‚Üí
   162‚ÜíCreate mock data that matches your plan.md schema exactly:
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí```typescript
   165‚Üí// Mock data matching plan.md schema
   166‚Üíconst mockWorkouts: Workout[] = [
   167‚Üí  {
   168‚Üí    record_id: 'mock-1',
   169‚Üí    createdat: '2025-01-30T10:00:00Z',
   170‚Üí    updatedat: null,
   171‚Üí    fields: {
   172‚Üí      name: 'Morning Run',
   173‚Üí      duration: 30,
   174‚Üí      date: '2025-01-30T10:00',  // Format matches date/datetimeminute
   175‚Üí      category: null,  // Would be applookup URL in real data
   176‚Üí    }
   177‚Üí  },
   178‚Üí  // ... more mock records
   179‚Üí];
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí// Type that matches what LivingApps would return
   182‚Üíinterface Workout {
   183‚Üí  record_id: string;
   184‚Üí  createdat: string;
   185‚Üí  updatedat: string | null;
   186‚Üí  fields: {
   187‚Üí    name: string;
   188‚Üí    duration: number;
   189‚Üí    date: string;
   190‚Üí    category: string | null;  // applookup can be null
   191‚Üí  };
   192‚Üí}
   193‚Üí```
   194‚Üí
   195‚Üí---
   196‚Üí
   197‚Üí## Making UI "Persistence-Ready"
   198‚Üí
   199‚ÜíDesign your components so they can easily switch from mock to real data:
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí### 1. Centralize Data Access
   202‚Üí
   203‚Üí```typescript
   204‚Üí// src/data/mockData.ts
   205‚Üíexport const mockWorkouts: Workout[] = [...];
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí// Dashboard.tsx - easy to replace later
   208‚Üíimport { mockWorkouts } from '@/data/mockData';
   209‚Üí// Later becomes: import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üífunction Dashboard() {
   212‚Üí  const [workouts, setWorkouts] = useState<Workout[]>(mockWorkouts);
   213‚Üí  // Later: useEffect(() => { LivingAppsService.getWorkouts().then(setWorkouts) }, []);
   214‚Üí}
   215‚Üí```
   216‚Üí
   217‚Üí### 2. Use Consistent Types
   218‚Üí
   219‚ÜíDefine types that match the plan.md schema:
   220‚Üí
   221‚Üí```typescript
   222‚Üí// src/types/app.ts (you create this manually for UI-first)
   223‚Üíexport interface Workout {
   224‚Üí  record_id: string;
   225‚Üí  createdat: string;
   226‚Üí  updatedat: string | null;
   227‚Üí  fields: {
   228‚Üí    name: string;
   229‚Üí    duration: number;
   230‚Üí    date: string;
   231‚Üí    category: string | null;
   232‚Üí  };
   233‚Üí}
   234‚Üí```
   235‚Üí
   236‚Üí### 3. Handle Null Values
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üíapplookup fields can be null. Always check:
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí```typescript
   241‚Üíconst categoryId = workout.fields.category;
   242‚Üíif (categoryId) {
   243‚Üí  // Show category name
   244‚Üí} else {
   245‚Üí  // Show "Uncategorized"
   246‚Üí}
   247‚Üí```
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí---
   250‚Üí
   251‚Üí## Example plan.md
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí```markdown
   254‚Üí# Persistence Plan: Fitness Tracker
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí## Summary
   257‚Üí
   258‚ÜíA personal fitness dashboard for tracking workouts and exercises. Users can log workouts, track progress over time, and manage their exercise library.
   259‚Üí
   260‚Üí## Proposed Apps
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí### App: workouts
   263‚Üí- **Name:** Workouts
   264‚Üí- **Purpose:** Stores individual workout sessions
   265‚Üí- **UI Components:** WorkoutList, AddWorkoutDialog, WeeklyChart
   266‚Üí- **Fields:**
   267‚Üí  - `name` (string): Workout name/title
   268‚Üí  - `duration` (number): Duration in minutes
   269‚Üí  - `date` (date/datetimeminute): When the workout occurred
   270‚Üí  - `exercise` (applookup): Link to exercise type
   271‚Üí  - `notes` (textarea): Optional notes
   272‚Üí
   273‚Üí### App: exercises
   274‚Üí- **Name:** Exercises
   275‚Üí- **Purpose:** Master data for exercise types
   276‚Üí- **UI Components:** ExerciseSelector, ExerciseManager
   277‚Üí- **Fields:**
   278‚Üí  - `name` (string): Exercise name
   279‚Üí  - `category` (lookup): Type of exercise
   280‚Üí  - `calories_per_minute` (number): Average calories burned
   281‚Üí
   282‚Üí## Relationships
   283‚Üí
   284‚Üí- workouts.exercise -> exercises (many-to-one)
   285‚Üí
   286‚Üí## JSON Schema
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí```json
   289‚Üí{
   290‚Üí  "apps": [
   291‚Üí    {
   292‚Üí      "name": "Exercises",
   293‚Üí      "identifier": "exercises",
   294‚Üí      "controls": {
   295‚Üí        "name": {
   296‚Üí          "fulltype": "string/text",
   297‚Üí          "label": "Name",
   298‚Üí          "required": true,
   299‚Üí          "in_list": true,
   300‚Üí          "in_text": true
   301‚Üí        },
   302‚Üí        "category": {
   303‚Üí          "fulltype": "lookup/select",
   304‚Üí          "label": "Category",
   305‚Üí          "lookups": [
   306‚Üí            {"key": "cardio", "value": "Cardio"},
   307‚Üí            {"key": "strength", "value": "Strength"},
   308‚Üí            {"key": "flexibility", "value": "Flexibility"}
   309‚Üí          ],
   310‚Üí          "in_list": true
   311‚Üí        },
   312‚Üí        "calories_per_minute": {
   313‚Üí          "fulltype": "number",
   314‚Üí          "label": "Calories per Minute",
   315‚Üí          "required": false
   316‚Üí        }
   317‚Üí      }
   318‚Üí    },
   319‚Üí    {
   320‚Üí      "name": "Workouts",
   321‚Üí      "identifier": "workouts",
   322‚Üí      "controls": {
   323‚Üí        "name": {
   324‚Üí          "fulltype": "string/text",
   325‚Üí          "label": "Name",
   326‚Üí          "required": true,
   327‚Üí          "in_list": true,
   328‚Üí          "in_text": true
   329‚Üí        },
   330‚Üí        "duration": {
   331‚Üí          "fulltype": "number",
   332‚Üí          "label": "Duration (min)",
   333‚Üí          "required": true,
   334‚Üí          "in_list": true
   335‚Üí        },
   336‚Üí        "date": {
   337‚Üí          "fulltype": "date/datetimeminute",
   338‚Üí          "label": "Date",
   339‚Üí          "required": true,
   340‚Üí          "in_list": true
   341‚Üí        },
   342‚Üí        "exercise": {
   343‚Üí          "fulltype": "applookup/select",
   344‚Üí          "label": "Exercise",
   345‚Üí          "lookup_app_ref": "exercises"
   346‚Üí        },
   347‚Üí        "notes": {
   348‚Üí          "fulltype": "string/textarea",
   349‚Üí          "label": "Notes",
   350‚Üí          "required": false
   351‚Üí        }
   352‚Üí      }
   353‚Üí    }
   354‚Üí  ]
   355‚Üí}
   356‚Üí```
   357‚Üí```
   358‚Üí
   359‚Üí---
   360‚Üí
   361‚Üí## Checklist Before Completing
   362‚Üí
   363‚Üí- [ ] `plan.md` created with valid JSON schema
   364‚Üí- [ ] JSON schema includes all fields shown in UI
   365‚Üí- [ ] Mock data matches schema structure
   366‚Üí- [ ] Types defined in `src/types/app.ts`
   367‚Üí- [ ] Mock data centralized in `src/data/mockData.ts`
   368‚Üí- [ ] All UI features work with mock data
   369‚Üí- [ ] `npm run build` passes
   370‚Üí- [ ] Deployed to GitHub Pages
   371‚Üí
   372‚Üí---
   373‚Üí
   374‚Üí## Definition of Done
   375‚Üí
   376‚ÜíThe UI-first dashboard is complete when:
   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí1. ‚úÖ Dashboard fully functional with mock data
   379‚Üí2. ‚úÖ `plan.md` exists with valid JSON schema
   380‚Üí3. ‚úÖ Types and mock data organized for easy replacement
   381‚Üí4. ‚úÖ All features work (not just display - actions too!)
   382‚Üí5. ‚úÖ Beautiful, distinctive design (not AI slop)
   383‚Üí6. ‚úÖ Mobile + Desktop responsive
   384‚Üí7. ‚úÖ No TypeScript errors
   385‚Üí8. ‚úÖ Deployed to GitHub Pages
   386‚Üí
   387‚Üí

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

content.text:
Der Schichtplaner wurde erstellt und deployed. Hier ist was ich implementiert habe:

**Funktionen:**
- **Wochenansicht**: √úbersichtliche Tabelle mit allen Mitarbeitern und ihren Schichten pro Wochentag
- **Direkte Bearbeitung**: Klick auf eine Schicht √∂ffnet einen Bearbeitungs-Dialog
- **Neue Schichten hinzuf√ºgen**: "+" Button in jeder Zelle
- **Navigation**: Vor/Zur√ºck Buttons und "Heute" um zwischen Wochen zu wechseln
- **Schichttypen**: Fr√ºhschicht (gelb), Sp√§tschicht (blau), Nachtschicht (indigo)
- **Mobile-freundlich**: Separate Ansicht f√ºr Smartphones mit Tages√ºbersicht
- **KPI-Karten**: Anzahl Mitarbeiter, heute im Dienst, Schichten diese Woche

**Dateien erstellt:**
- `plan.md` - Datenbankschema f√ºr sp√§tere Persistenz
- `src/types/app.ts` - TypeScript Types
- `src/data/mockData.ts` - Mock-Daten mit 5 Mitarbeitern und Beispiel-Schichten
- `src/pages/Dashboard.tsx` - Das komplette Dashboard
